metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1629 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Over-read in function find_next_quote in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4925. This vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software, Modify Memory, and possible remote execution

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-athena - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-common - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-motif - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-nox - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
xxd - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.2.5166-0ubuntu1').
